Powerful Dark Magic saturated the bones of long-dead dragons, raising them to new purpose.

Camel
Jaffar is a vainglorious man, it is no wonder then that the prestigious camel is one of his favourite mounts to ride into battle.
Royal Elephant
From on top the howdah of a mighty Arabyan Royal Elephant, Sultan Jaffar gazes down upon the battlefield with only imperious cruelty and disdain in his eyes.
Griffon

Hailing from the highest peaks of the World's Edge Mountains, Arabyans just like the northern Imperials are willing to pay vast sums of gold for a single egg or chick such the renown of these majestic beasts.
Royal Elephant
Elephants are unstoppable beasts. Trained on the battlefield, they lead Araby's leaders to war, wiping out everything that gets in their way.

Some of the fastest and most furious breeds of horse come from the lands of Araby.

Oidhche
A giant crow Morrigan may ride to battle. No other giant crows have ever been seen in Albion and its origin remains a mystery.
Albion Warhorse
The inhabitants of Albion ride horses to battle who are as temperamental and hardy as their riders.
Albion Chariot

Skeletal Steed
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
Barded Skeletal Steed
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death, wrapped in blackened\\nsteel to protect the bones underneath.
Skeleton Chariot
Bone steeds pull dreaded chariots made from thick steel, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding all beneath their heavy wheels.

Khemrian Warsphinx
Through the actions of Traitor Kings, the forces of Nagash have access to Warsphinxes.
Carmine, or Encarmine Dragons, are a corrupted variant of the Dragon race known famously for its dark crimson color as a result of an over-exposure to "Death Magic".
Sharpclaw
Astride his griffon, Sharpclaw, Althran swoops down on his chosen foe and cuts them down with talon and beak.

Warhorse
Born to a family of Arabyan caravan nomads, Fatandira is as comfortable on the saddle as on foot.
Saqir

Given to Fatandira as a gift by the Scythans, Saqir is a mighty specimen of Desert Roc, giant and intelligent birds of prey that fly high above the deserts of Araby. The animal quickly bonded with her, and now they soar the battlefield together.
Camel
Though vigorous and spry for his old age, the Golden Magus often rides to battle on one of his many camels - out of flamboyance if anything else.
Djinn Skiff

Much like the Magus' infamous flagship, this enchanted skiff is proof of his mastery over the Djinn. Held "afloat" on the air by servile Lesser Tempest Djinn oarsmen, this is one of the Golden Magus' favourite ways to ride to battle.
Some Master Chefs choose to carry their kitchen onto the battlefield in a chuck wagon.
Many Halfling commanders choose to ride the largest Moot Cockerel specimens into battle.
Many Halfling commanders choose to ride pigs into battle. Hey, what, stop laughing.

One major advantage the camel provides for these mounted archers is simply a better angle for their arrows to aim true than from their horse counterparts. Albeit, mounted archery on a camel is no easy task!
Armed with long-barrelled arquebus of Arabyan design, the endless deserts have taught these men the value of marksmanship and an accurate firearm.
The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament.
The barded steeds of the nobles are the greatest chargers from a nation that prides itself on its equestrian pedigree.

Dual Weapons
Some Hashashin are known to favor dual scimitars in their terrible work.
Marsh Hound

Boglar Shamans are often gifted Marsh Hounds by the Fimir. It can be considered a form of reward or punishment. If the Hound devours the Shaman, it was a punishment. If the Shaman tames the hound, it was a reward.
